Protocols/Transitionable.html#/s:8Gauntl.name: shouldTransition(to:)
Protocols/Transitionable.html#/s:8Gauntl.abstract: Defines whether a transition from self to the given state is valid.

Protocols/Transitionable.html.name: Transitionable
Protocols/Transitionable.html.abstract: The “state” part of our finite state machine.

Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.name: state
Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.abstract: The current state of the state machine. Read-only.

Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.name: wrappedValue
Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.abstract: The value of the wrapped property when StateMachine is used as a property wrapper. Getting the value is equivalent to state. Setting the value is equivalent to calling transition(to:) with the new value.

Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.name: projectedValue
Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.abstract: The projected value of the property (that is, the value when the property is prepended with a $) when StateMachine is used as a property wrapper.

Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.name: init(initialState:)
Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.abstract: Initializes the state machine with the given initial state.

Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.name: init(wrappedValue:)
Classes/StateMachine.html#/s:8Gauntlet12.abstract: Initializer called when using StateMachine as a property wrapper.

Classes/StateMachine.html.name: StateMachine
Classes/StateMachine.html.abstract: The “machine” part of our finite state machine.
